doc.Question: Consider a tripartite state <Math>\rho_{ABC}<\Math> consisting of d-dimensional qudits. Let A, B, C contain NA, NB, and NC qubits, respectively. Suppose there exist a channel R acting on the Hilbert space and outputing to the Hilbert space of AB such that <Math> || R[\rho_{BC}] - \rho_{ABC} ||_1 = \epsilon<\Math>. One can show that the conditional mutual information <Math>I(A:C|B) \le c*\sqrt{\epsilon}<\Math>. How does the prefactor c depend on d, NA, NB, and NC? You can throw away all the constants
